paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision ../../structure/project.xmlProjects managed files, as described in vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects 0 Item Management in Projects . EiffelEnvision also manages linked project items, via the ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Items hierarchy, but only to support referencing existing items related to the project.

All aspects of an EiffelEnvision ../../structure/project.xmlProject are hierarchal providing you with the facilities to structure and organize your projects as such. To facilitate the creation of file and folder hierarchies, New Folders can be created under every type of folder. The type of folder added will depend on the section of the project you are adding a new folder to. For the most part EiffelEnvision managed files. The exception is the ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Items section of a ../../structure/project.xmlProject. This is manages links to files. For more information, see vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects 0 Item Management in Projects .

To add a folder, select a folder in your EiffelEnvision project. Now select Project, New Folder. Alternatively select the Add, New Folder from the folder context menu. If the ../../structure/project.xmlProject Node is selected when adding a new folder, the resulting folder will be added to the ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items section of your project, because they have the same ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath.

Once selecting to add a new folder, a new folder will appear under the folder you selected when adding it. The new folder will automatically be ready for a new name, overriding the default new_folder_ith. When choosing a name for the folder, it must contain only those characters legally excepted for Windows folder names.
